title: Here's a first look at the dazzling visuals coming to next-gen consoles like the PlayStation 5 and next Xbox
text:
The PlayStation 5 and a new Xbox console, Microsoft's "Project Scarlett," are scheduled to launch next year.

New console generations have lots of new bells and whistles, but one constant has been major graphics improvements.

We've yet to see what the next PlayStation and Xbox are capable of visually, but we just got a good look at next-gen visuals, care of the Japanese game company that makes "Final Fantasy," Square Enix.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

After nearly six years, both Sony's PlayStation 4 and Microsoft's Xbox One are on the verge of being replaced. The PlayStation 5 and "Project Scarlett" are expected to launch in 2020.

We already know a little bit about both, but there's one huge detail we've yet to see: What will games look like on next-gen gaming platforms?

Thanks to a new demo video from Square Enix, the "Final Fantasy" publisher, we just got our first taste of what to expect in 2020 — take a look:
description: With the PlayStation 5 and the next Xbox console on the horizon, we're beginning to get our first glimpses of what those consoles could be able to do.
